column4: I have mounted a dir to a share that is gone, and the timeout is so long that I can't unmount it
I think even the unmount times out because the ip is gone
//192.168.0.100/N on /home/user/Network/N type cifs (rw,mand) in the end
you did mount -l, you need umount -l
anything with bluez in the name is for bluetooth
the unattended-upgrades service surprisingly comes from the unattended-upgrades package :)
unless you don't want a GUI you should keep it :)
but what is the package that installs the x11-common service? I tried apt-get remove --purge x11-common*
you can remove everything with x11 in the name x11 is the gui
ok, how do I halt a apt-get that I started by mistake?
